articles.headline: A Governor’s High School Basketball Dreams Are Blocked. And He Is Crying Foul.
articles.snippet: As his state was battered by Covid-19, Gov. Jim Justice of West Virginia applied to coach a boys’ team in his spare time. When the school board rejected him, he threatened to haul the members before a judge.
articles.abstract: As his state was battered by Covid-19, Gov. Jim Justice of West Virginia applied to coach a boys’ team in his spare time. When the school board rejected him, he threatened to haul the members before a judge.
articles.lead_paragraph: LEWISBURG, W.Va. — The governor was livid.

articles.headline: News Media Can’t Shake ‘Missing White Woman Syndrome,’ Critics Say
articles.snippet: Major outlets have highlighted the case of Gabrielle Petito while often ignoring stories about women of color who go missing.
articles.abstract: Major outlets have highlighted the case of Gabrielle Petito while often ignoring stories about women of color who go missing.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

articles.headline: Federal Reserve Signals a Shift Away From Pandemic Support
articles.snippet: The Fed said it could soon slow its large-scale purchases of government-backed bonds and indicated it might raise interest rates in 2022.
articles.abstract: The Fed said it could soon slow its large-scale purchases of government-backed bonds and indicated it might raise interest rates in 2022.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials indicated on Wednesday that they expect to soon slow the asset purchases they have been using to support the economy and predicted they might raise interest rates next year, sending a clear signal that policymakers are preparing to curtail full-blast monetary help as the business environment snaps back from the pandemic shock.

articles.headline: Biden Pushes Deterrent Border Policy After Promising ‘Humane’ Approach
articles.snippet: The deportation of Haitian migrants is a stark example of how President Biden has deployed some of the most aggressive approaches to immigration put in place by former President Donald J. Trump.
articles.abstract: The deportation of Haitian migrants is a stark example of how President Biden has deployed some of the most aggressive approaches to immigration put in place by former President Donald J. Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The images could have come straight from former President Donald J. Trump’s immigration playbook: mounted Border Patrol agents rounding up desperate Haitian families at the southwestern border for rapid deportation from the United States.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear, Natalie Kitroeff, Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Eileen Sullivan

articles.headline: F.D.A. Authorizes Pfizer Booster Shots for Older and At-Risk Americans
articles.snippet: Regulators said that people over 65 or at high risk of severe Covid-19 were eligible for an extra shot, setting up a staggered national booster campaign.
articles.abstract: Regulators said that people over 65 or at high risk of severe Covid-19 were eligible for an extra shot, setting up a staggered national booster campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After weeks of internal strife at the Food and Drug Administration, the agency on Wednesday authorized people over 65 who had received Pfizer-BioNTech’s coronavirus vaccine to get a booster shot at least six months after their second injection.
articles.byline: By Noah Weiland and Sharon LaFraniere

articles.headline: Biden Huddles With Democrats as Divisions Threaten His Agenda
articles.snippet: Democrats are nearing a make-or-break moment for President Biden’s agenda, with party divisions imperiling top-priority legislation and fiscal crises looming.
articles.abstract: Democrats are nearing a make-or-break moment for President Biden’s agenda, with party divisions imperiling top-priority legislation and fiscal crises looming.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow our live news coverage on the government shutdown and infrastructure bill.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Weisman, Emily Cochrane and Jim Tankersley

articles.headline: An Experiment to Stop Online Abuse Falls Short in Germany
articles.snippet: Despite having one of the world’s toughest laws against online hate speech and harassment, Germany has struggled to contain toxic content ahead of its Sept. 26 election.
articles.abstract: Despite having one of the world’s toughest laws against online hate speech and harassment, Germany has struggled to contain toxic content ahead of its Sept. 26 election.
articles.lead_paragraph: Scrolling through her social media feed, Laura Dornheim is regularly stopped cold by a new blast of abuse aimed at her, including from people threatening to kill or sexually assault her. One person last year said he looked forward to meeting her in person so he could punch her teeth out.

articles.headline: In a setback for Apple, the European Union seeks a common charger for all phones.
articles.snippet: The push to make USB-C connectors standard on all mobile devices would primarily affect Apple, which uses proprietary technology for charging.
articles.abstract: The push to make USB-C connectors standard on all mobile devices would primarily affect Apple, which uses proprietary technology for charging.
articles.lead_paragraph: The European Union unveiled plans on Thursday to make USB-C connectors the standard charging port for all smartphones, tablets and other electronic devices sold across the bloc, an initiative that it says will reduce environmental waste but that is likely to hit Apple the hardest.
